events.name: Introduction to Automation with Selenium
events.description: Hands on Test automation series We are happy to invite you to the second edition of vodQA on Saturday August 29th, 2015 at the ThoughtWorks Singapore office. vodQA (Value Oriented Discussion for Quality Analysts), a forum where testing enthusiasts get together, network and collaborate on the latest developments in the world of software testing. So far, we have successfully hosted more than 20 editions of vodQA across all ThoughtWorks India offices. And now, the most successful testing un-conference is making its debut in Singapore. Introduction to Automation with Selenium This workshop is intended to impart a basic knowledge of Automation and Selenium. A robust hands-on experience setting up Selenium, simple tests, sessions on debugging tests and executing them will be the key takeaways. This edition is going to be an interactive workshop where you will get selenium exposure from basics to hands-on. This vodQA aims at getting you up-to-speed on how to start using Selenium. NOTE: Registration is free for all and food will be provided. Please bring your own laptops for the event. *Limited seats -  Confirmation of attendance will be sent by separate email shortly.  Registrations are managed from ThoughtWorks.com portal. So make sure you follow the link to register! http://info.thoughtworks.com/vodqa-sg-aug-2015.html
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: [RSVP closed] The Orange Hive Community: Content to Conversion
events.description:
Another weekend hands-on session by the Orange Hive Community: Content to Conversion! 

Our buying behaviour has shifted greatly ever since the ubiquity of information. The traditional media and approach in selling has been proven ineffective in our attention deficit world. What seemed to convert prospects to customers brilliantly in the past (such as cold calls, door-to-door) has turned into a great form of irritation. Even generic forms of engagement through new media is starting to get irritating. Let's face it, we hate to be sold to; so does your customers.

 
So how to we stay ahead of the game in engaging our potential customers?

Enter Content Marketing.

In this Content to Conversion workshop, you'll learn:
- the best approaches to sell to YOUR audience
- techniques and tools to garner traffic
- conversion framework 
- how to maximise conversion with your available resources 

We're privileged to have Sheena as our Star Mentor for this session. 
As a communications specialist at Text100 Singapore, Sheena has developed and executed integrated communications and branding activities across earned, owned and paid media for corporate, institutional and consumer clients for the past 5 years. This makes her THE go-to person for this topic ;)


Venue: TBC
Price: $15 (door fee)
Date: 29th August 2015 (Saturday)
Time: 10am - 2pm 
*Lunch provided.
RSVP here: http://goo.gl/forms/ysZO8Y1jR8

See you there!

Cheers, 
Aishah, Sheena, Angela, Kai Xin
events.location: Google, 8 Marina View, Level 32, Asia Square 1, 018960 (downtown Mrt)

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (August)
events.description: How is everyone feeling after RDRC? As we approach the third-quarter of the year, it's time to start consolidating and practising what we've learnt! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts!  Come and join us at the August Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15   Registration • 10:15 - 10:20   Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30  Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00  Start to code  ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Sherwyn - Ted - Sai - Aravindh - Lachlan - Tania Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).
events.location: SkyScanner Ltd, 39 Robinson Road #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #012
events.description:

Paper #2 - Robust Range-Only Beacon Localization : Ashish Raste - https://people.csail.mit.edu/teller/pubs/robl.pdf

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

events.name: Micro Service testing setup in the cloud
events.description: Hello everyone The next meetup will be hosted on the 2nd of September. Mark your calendars!  ************************** Talk Details ************************** Speaker - Rajesh Lingappa @ Redmart  More details coming soon. ************************************ DevopsDays Singapore 2015 ************************************ *DevOpsDays what?!* DevOpsDays is a 2-day community driven unconference for DevOps-minded people like you that will be held in Singapore on October 16th and 17th, 2015. Get your early bird tickets now!https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015/ Got something to talk about? Half hour talks or 5 minute Ignites! Submit a talk now!  http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/propose/ *Why so special ah?* DevOpsDays are not the typical tech conference you might know. DevOpsDays follow a quite unique format and in this meetup we'd like to introduce you the core concepts of DevOpsDays. DevOpsDays works best when you step out of your comfort zone and contribute by asking questions, suggesting ideas for open spaces, talk etc. Look out in your inboxes for updates on keynote speaker and program updates! A BIG Shout out to our sponsors who are making this event a reality and turbo charging the DevOps Community in Singapore.  Cheers, Christian & Satyam

events.name: TGIFHacks #36:   Talk by Garuda Robotics - Commercial Drone Applications and Technologies
events.description:
Hey guys!

We are excited to present TGIFHacks #36:  
Talk by Garuda Robotics(http://www.garuda.io/#) - Commercial Drone Applications and Technologies

Speaker profile:
Ong Jiin Joo is the CTO and co-founder of Garuda Robotics. One of his major focus is this idea of “Cloud Robotics”, where robots deployed into the real world are orchestrated in the cloud, leveraging ample compute resource in the cloud to make better use of ubiquitous environment data. Jiin Joo’s earliest career started in Amazon.com’s web development teams. In the years prior to starting up, he worked with SCS, IDA and Singtel to spearhead the test-bedding of new technologies and help enterprise customers adopt these new technologies, which includes fibre connectivity, business continuity, procurement exchanges, SaaS web apps, and enterprise mobility.

Garuda Robotics is a leading drone solutions provider based in Singapore. Operating across Southeast Asia in the agriculture, building management, and security industries, we generate actionable insights for our clients by combining drone aerial data with advanced analytics.



Refreshments will be served, so do come hungry :)

events.name: Front End Web Development - A Crash Course Coding Workshop
events.description: CALLING EVERYONE INTERESTED IN PROGRAMMING, OR NEED THE SKILLS TO ENHANCE YOUR CAREER! Have you ever wondered what are the most essential Front-End languages tech companies are looking for? Web Development is lucrative in this age of rapidly advancing technology - The fact is, coding is NOW high in demand. Do you have what it takes to learn web development skills? Here's a time saver! Get your hands dirty for this one day hands-on, immersive workshop that is developed by the industry. --- << SEMINAR DETAILS >> Date: SEPTEMBER 5th, 2015 (Sat) Time: 0930h - 1830h Venue: Auston Institute of Management50 Ophir Road , #02-00, Church Of Our Lady Of Lourdes, singapore, Singapore[masked] << PRICE >>  Early bird: SGD 135 (SAVE 25%) Available till 24th August!Regular ticket: SGD 180Max Capacity: 12 pax ONLY! << REGISTER NOW ON EVENTNOOK >> https://www.eventnook.com/event/register/55529 ** Please note that you will need to register at Eventnook in order to secure a placement in our workshop. --- << WHO SHOULD JOIN >>  We recommend anyone who looking to learn about Front-End Development. This program is ideal for beginners or other developers versed in other languages looking to explore Front-End Development for personal or professional projects. This expands their portfolio or gears them up for a career switch. << WHAT YOU WILL LEARN >>  • Understand the fundamental of Front-End Web Development Languages. • Familiarize the technique of implementing and modifying CSS Framework with Twitter Bootstrap.  • Build Responsive App that work on all screen sizes—desktop, tablet and mobile. • Learn to speak the most important programming language: JavaScript. • How to employ jQuery library for event handing and DOM manipulation.  • Building a first hands-on Web Application. • Steps to deploy website from local server to live site.  • Explore the methods of dealing with cross browsing compatibility. NOTE: This curriculum was developed in consultation by numerous technology startups and software development companies. You will gain quick understanding of Front-end languages and tools widely used in the industry! An Outcome-Based Structure means that you will learn the tricks and techniques they employ in their daily work life! << BRING THESE WITH YOU >> Please bring along your MacBook or Windows laptop for the hands-on exercises. << ORGANIZED BY AUSTON >> Our mission is to match-make your passion and talents to the rapidly evolving information technology space. We aim for you to be connected with our network of industry partners and mentors, who yearns to impart their professional expertise in both coding and management. We are here to unleash the giant in YOU. auston.edu.sg/workshop/
events.location: Auston Institute of Management, 50 Ophir Road, #02-00, Singapore

events.name: Project Accelerator: Lien AID, Phandeeyar and Liberty Asia
events.description:
Our Project Accelerator will bring together experts with data science and analytical backgrounds to help non-profit organizations take the first steps to a successful data science project.   To ensure that our discussions are productive, we have to limit the number of people that can attend this event. Unfortunately, that means that not everyone who wishes to attend will be able to. Please do think about the RSVP questions and how you will be able to contribute to the discussions. Sign up if you’re ready to be an active participant! For this event, we will be featuring Lien AID, Phandeeyar and Liberty Asia. Agenda 1 pm: Registration (NO food will be provided, so please have your lunch before) 1.15 pm: Introduction  1.30 pm: Overview by Featured Non-Profit Organizations 2pm: Break-out for group discussions 4.30 pm: Reconvene to share learnings, and see how this can be brought forward Special thanks to ThoughtWorks for being our venue sponsor! One Pagers Lien AID Phandeeyar Liberty Asia How it works Each non-profit organization will have its own breakout group of interested volunteers and a facilitator to brainstorm and discuss ideas to help the organization get ready to embark on a data project. There will not be any data or coding. General discussion topics • What is your organization's goal? What does the world look like when you succeed? • What is the biggest problem you're facing? • What does your data look like (specific questions as needed)? • What types of questions can you answer with the data you have? • What problems do you have with your current data? • Where can you find or how can you better collect the data you need? • What do you think you can takeaway from this discussion, and what will be a good next step? Lien AID Lien AID is an international non-profit committed to enabling sustainable access to clean water and sanitation for Asia’s rural poor. Founded in 2006, Lien AID focuses on community-based approaches in the delivery of multi-year scalable and sustainable Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) programmes. Through partnerships with local governments, civil society organisations and private businesses, they hope to provide the impetus for better water governance and a future where clean water access is available to everyone. More information can be found in Lien AID's one pager Phandeeyar Phandeeyar is an ICT hub that is designed to support social innovation, civictech and ICT4D (ICT for Development) in Myanmar. Phandeeyar brings the tech community together with others who are moving Myanmar forward – such as civil society organizations, social enterprises and independent media – to build the digital tools, platforms and content to accelerate change and development. A lot of the programs fit under the category of building up Myanmar’s open data community. More information can be found in Phandeeyar's one pager Liberty Asia Liberty Asia is an anti-human trafficking NGO based in Hong Kong, founded in 2011. Liberty Asia’s goal is to provide new solutions to change the way slavery and trafficking is addressed. Programmes are focused in East and Southeast Asia. More information can be found in Liberty Asia's one pager 


RSVP questions: 1) Which organization would you like to break out with: • Lien AID • Phandeeyar • Liberty Asia 2) How do you think you can you contribute to that specific organization?

events.name: Meteor September Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our September MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! ***  Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm.  ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Ramda.js: another underscore? - Maxim Filimonov Maxim will talk about this functional javascript library. Details: http://ramdajs.com/0.17/index.html #2 - Quick & Dirty Infinite Scroll - Duncan Foster Duncan will explain how to quickly add infinite scrolling functionality to your Meteor application. #3 - Meteor Clinic: - If anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' (</a>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question) #4 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg/">https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: </a>https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: <a href="http://singapore.meteor.com/">http://singapore.meteor.com/ #5 Socializing / Networking  ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Please note this is a new location for us. Thanks to Duncan for helping to organize. We should have food/beverages provided by the venue ;-) Organizers: Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Duncan Foster Venue sponsor: Netsuite
events.location: Netsuite, 9 Battery Road, #08-01, Straits Trading Building, Singapore

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #4: Rapid Mobile Development with Ionic Framework
events.description: It's the 4th Bluemix meetup, and this iteration we have Raymond Camden, developer advocate for IBM, who is flying down all the way from US to do a speaking tour over multiple cities including Kuala Lumpur, Singapore and Philippines. Here's the agenda: 6:00pm to 7:00pm - Registration + Dinner7:00pm to 8:00pm - Mobile Apps with Ionic Framework by Raymond Camden8:00pm to 9:00pm - Open for Topics / Discussion Create amazing mobile apps rapidly with Ionic Framework Ionic is a complete open-source SDK for hybrid mobile app development. Built on top of Angular.JS and Apache Cordova, Ionic provides tools and services for developing hybrid mobile apps using web technologies like HTML5, CSS, and Sass. Learn from Raymond Camden how you can quickly use Ionic to create a beautiful, fast, and responsive mobile apps across both iOS and Android. Raymond Camden Bio:Raymond Camden is a developer advocate for IBM. His work focuses on the MobileFirst platform, hybrid mobile development, Node.js, HTML5, and ColdFusion. He's a published author and presents at conferences and user groups on a variety of topics. Raymond can be reached at his blog (www.raymondcamden.com), @raymondcamden on Twitter.  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.

events.name: [Workshop] Build your Hybrid Mobile App with Ionic, MobileFirst and Bluemix
events.description: You've heard from Raymond Camden about Ionic Framework. Now learn from Raymond directly with this hands-on workshop. Build your Hybrid Mobile App with Ionic, MobileFirst and BluemixGet your hands-on experience with Ionic Framework, IBM MobileFirst services on Bluemix in this workshop. Learn how to develop and build your hybrid mobile application with Ionic, and your back-end servers supporting push notifications, data synchronisation and logging with MobileFirst and Bluemix. To have an idea on Ionic, you may browse the following links:http://ionicframework.com/http://ionicframework.com/getting-started/http://www.raymondcamden.com/2015/03/23/working-with-ibm-mobilefirst-and-the-ionic-framework Reminders:Bring your own laptop with the following installation:    • text editor (e.g., Sublime text)    • Android SDK    • Node.js (specifically npm)    • Create a Bluemix account (http://bit.ly/bluemixsg) Pre-requisite:    • Basic "web" knowledge - HTML, CSS, and JS. You don't have to be an expert, just know the basics.    • Basic "mobile" knowledge - have used a smart phone of some sort and get what 'apps' are. Raymond Camden Bio:Raymond Camden is a developer advocate for IBM. His work focuses on the MobileFirst platform, hybrid mobile development, Node.js, HTML5, and ColdFusion. He's a published author and presents at conferences and user groups on a variety of topics. Raymond can be reached at his blog (www.raymondcamden.com), @raymondcamden on Twitter.  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.

events.name: Come watch the live Ace of Coders finals
events.description: Hi everyone. More than 450 Singaporean students are practicing their python skills this month as part of the IDA Ace of Coders online qualification. If you know any secondary school students or JC students in Singapore, please encourage them to participate. The top 10 schools in each category will get to attend the live event at Suntec City on September 10th and compete for over $9000 in cash prizes.  You can mark your calendar now and plan to come watch some of the best school-aged python developers in Singapore complete in a DOTA2-style Code Combat arena. You can also checkout the latest school rankingsto see how the schools you are most interested in are doing.
events.location: Suntec City Convention Centre, Hall 403, 1 Raffles Boulevard, Suntec City, Singapore 039593

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Gazelle Twin and Special Guests
10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
FREE

This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents.

 Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin.  Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”.

Joining Gazelle Twin will be a carefully curated selection of audio visual and electronic artists from Singapore to present an evening of the most innovative and imaginative breaking sounds from the UK and Singapore underground.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: Investment Trends in Southeast Asia -- How Investors Look at the Region? by @Justin Hall
events.description:
This session is intended to help attendees understand how investors look at potential investments and close deals. It'll not only cover broad investment trends in Singapore and Southeast Asia, but will also help entrepreneurs understand such complex issues like determining when to raise, understanding key terms on a term sheet, and how to pitch to investors. 

Justin Hall is Principal at Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Singapore but investing across Southeast Asia, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. 

As principal, he manages Golden Gate Ventures' existing portfolio while sourcing investments across APAC. In addition, he is director for Golden Gate Ventures Annex Fund, focused on follow-on funding for existing portfolio companies.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR ATTENDEES:

* Lunch is sponsored by Golden Gate Ventures for this Hackers & Painters session

* Venue sponsor: NUS Enterprise as usual! :-)

* NUS Enterprise/Plugin has moved to #02-09, so look for the new space right by the stair case on Level 2, Blk 71!  Do not go to the old location at #02-18

See you!

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description:
PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already.  After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you.  Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that.  Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans 


Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week!  What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 

We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! 


If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. **DISCLAIMER**: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Front End TL;DR
events.description: Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at Viki ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks7:15pm — Intro talk by the host7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned9:30pm — The end. There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided. Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/

events.name: DSSG Sep Meetup - Garuda Robotics
events.description: *Please note that RSVP will only start on Sunday (20 Sep, 2015), 12:00pm.*  Garuda Robotics builds drone systems and use them to capture data and generate actionable insights. For this meetup, they will share about using drone captured photos for computer vision. Synopsis: TBC Agenda: • 7.00pm - 7.15pm: Networking • 7.15pm - 8.15pm: Garuda Robotics (TBC) • 8.15pm - 8.30pm: Closing and Networking
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), 90 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!

events.name: Papers We Love #013
events.description:
Paper #1: Learning to Transduce with Unbounded Memory: Alex Ognev - http://arxiv.org/abs/1506.02516

Paper #2: Zippier ZMap: Internet-Wide Scanning at 10 Gbps - Lukas Dunphy - https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/woot14/woot14-adrian.pdf

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy Advanced Features - A Demo
events.description: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) is an integrated penetration testing tool for finding vulnerabilities in web applications. Over the past few years, it has significantly grown its popularity, features and contributions from WW engineers, as it comes straight out of the OWASP community, absolutely free of cost and most of all, easy to use! This demo-based training session covers the basics and advanced features of ZAP, which will enable application developers to understand and automate the tool usage, application testers to perform security tests and security engineers to provide consultation on best-practices of using the tool. Speaker:Viswanath S Chirravuri has over 10 years of experience in IT Security space. Currently he is a Software Security Architect for Asia region at a leading digital security company, GEMALTO. He actively holds industry certifications like CISSP, CEH, GWAPT, Security+, PMP and SCJP. Viswanath is accredited by CA Technologies on Identity and Access management suite of products. Over the past 3 years, he has been giving training's on various SAST and DAST tools to application security engineers in financial services and telecommunications industries. NOTE:1. You will need to sign in at ground floor security counter of One Raffles Place Tower 2.2. Akamai will provide a brief update on their view of the threat landscape, and security portfolio.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616
